sentences: Tallinna jalgpalli staadion on väga suur.
context: The word 'jalgpalli' is the genitive case of 'jalgpall', which means 'football' or 'association soccer'. In Estonian, the '-i ending typically indicates the genitive case used to show possession or relationship. So 'jalgpalli' literally translates to 'of football' and is used when describing something related to football, such as in phrases like 'jalgpalli staadion' (football stadium) or 'jalgpalli meeskond' (football team).
